page.title: 05The Northwich Guardian
page.content: The two main local newspapers are the Northwich Guardian and the Northwich Chronicle.Other Newspapers are the World and the Advertiser,which are free circulars.The Guardian is published once a week and sells about 15000 copies.Advertising pays for most of the Guardian.Most adverts are by estate agents selling housing.The general public can advertise as well.A 5 line advert may cost Â£2.00 but a full page business advert may cost thousands of pounds. The main story in the June,7th edition concerned the Octel Company who planned to bury 5,000 tonnes of toxic lead near the village of Lostock. Local opposition to the plan was strong, claiming that the lead was a health hazard. The Octel plant is due to close in June 1985 due to the reduction of lead in petrol.
